vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
πόρπ-η, ἡ,
(πείρω) ={περόνη}, brooch, clasp for fastening dresses, especially on the shoulders; used for piercing the eyes, [Refs 5th c.BC+]: mostly plural, of the fastenings for women's dresses, [Refs 8th c.BC+]; worn as emblem of rank by συγγενεῖς τῶν βασιλέων, [LXX]; by a Roman officer,=fibula, [Refs]; of a hair-clasp, [Refs 2nd c.AD+]
